Title: Harvey's Cashier & Garnisher - Hamilton, ON - Indeed.com

Harvey's is looking for experienced Cashiers/Garnishers
At Harvey's, we deliver delicious “home-made” food, made fresh, in-house just for you. Our atmosphere is warm, welcoming and feels like home. We work as a team and help each other succeed. Our Managers are hands-on and our team works together to deliver the Perfect Guest Experience to our guests each and every time. We genuinely care about each Guest and every Associate.
We are looking for individuals that are passionate about Food, Hospitality, and are Guest focused as well as being a strong and motivating team player.
Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
Deliver Perfect Guest Experience by ensuring food quality is at the highest standards of Harvey's established food quality and plating specifications
The successful candidate is expected to be a leader in demonstrating behaviours consistent with Recipe Unlimited Corporation's (previously known as Cara) Principles

Have open availability; evenings and weekends
BONUS: Can work day shift throughout the week, Monday to Friday
Food Service/Hospitality Experience
Must have a love of food and strive for culinary excellence
Driven and focused
Inspirational/Motivational
At Harvey's “Every Guest Leaves Happy ”!
If you are interested in working at this location please apply today
As part of our accessibility commitment, there are alternative ways to interview with us. Please inform us if you require interview accommodation.
Please note that any offer of employment may be subject to reference checks and background checks, including a criminal record check as part of the selection process.
Some opportunities may exist with our Franchise partners which are independently owned and operated.

Title: Lottery Kiosk Sales Associate - Canada - Indeed.com
Description:
Lottery Kiosk Sales Associate
Health Sciences North Volunteer Association (HSNVA)
Health Sciences North Volunteer Association (HSNVA) in Greater Sudbury, ON
$14.35 an hour - Part-time, Permanent
Apply now
Who We Are:
The Health Sciences North Volunteer Association (HSNVA) operates two businesses within the
walls of Health Sciences North (HSN) in order to raise funds to support health care initiatives.
Governed by our board of directors, and staffed mainly by volunteers, these operations offer
unique services to patrons of the hospital.
Position Overview:
The Lottery Kiosk Sales Associate is responsible for carrying out a full range of duties of the
position in a professional, responsible, accurate and timely fashion. The Lottery Kiosk Sales
Associate will provide customers with friendly service and will perform transactions in an
efficient manner. The Lottery Kiosk Sales Associate will ensure accurate cash-handling
procedures at all times through HSNVA practices, and actively contribute to customer
engagement.
Responsibilities:

Greet and serve customers in a friendly manner.

Resolve customer issues in a timely and positive manner.

Perform transactions and cash reconciliation at end of shift.

Verify the age of customers when selling lottery tickets.

Learn all OLG offerings, games and policies.

Manage inventory levels of all lottery.

Ensure loss prevention standards are followed and maintain proper security of cash and
merchandise.

Maintain a neat and organized kiosk through regular housekeeping, such and dusting and
tidying up.

Regularly check the communications book to keep up to date.

Adhere to all HSNVA policies and procedures.
Qualifications:

Previous retail experience preferred.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to work well within a team.

Ability to receive feedback and take action when appropriate.

Able to stand and move about for long periods of time; reach, bend, stoop, etc. to handle
products.

Ability to work with little supervision.

Ability to work flexible shifts which may include nights, weekends and holidays.

Proficient with technology.
HSNVA operates its businesses within Health Sciences North (HSN) and must comply with the
Hospital's COVID-19 Vaccination Surveillance Program. Full vaccination for COVID-19 is
required for all employees. Accordingly, you will be required to provide proof of full
vaccination. Exceptions may be made for individuals who are unable to receive a COVID-19
vaccine for legislative protected reasons.
Application deadline: 2021-11-30
Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Pay: $14.35 per hour
Benefits:

On-site parking
COVID-19 considerations:
Full vaccination for COVID-19 is required for all employees. Accordingly, you will be required
to provide proof of full vaccination. Exceptions may be made for individuals who are unable to
receive a COVID-19 vaccine for legislative protected reasons.


customer service: 1 year (required)

Day Shift (required)

No

Title: CAISSIER(ÈRE) PRINCIPAL(E) - Sainte-Foy, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Position Purpose:
The front end is the last opportunity we have to thank our customers and show them we appreciate their business. The Head Cashier is accountable to ensure this occurs by carrying out the responsibilities listed in this description as well as holding the Front End associates accountable to effectively carry out their duties and responsibilities.
Position Responsibilities:
We're looking for the type of associates who can tap into their inner orange. Overseeing work activity within his/her department, motivating the team to consistently demonstrate Customer FIRST behaviours.
Driving awareness of current promotions by providing Front End associates with promotion locations so they can effectively direct customers , communicating store and Home Depot objectives to associates
Training and supervising Cashiers (including cashiers in all remote cashier locations) and Lot Associates
Setting clear performance expectations as well as providing on the job feedback
Providing outstanding service to both external and internal Customers by ensuring efficient Front End and Remote Cashier operations
Handling customer complaints in a professional manner
Providing a safe working and shopping environment by following all safety policies & standards
Completing specified safety training, immediately correcting hazards ; unsafe conditions or reporting conditions to the Manager On Duty, and working safely as not to endanger themselves, co-workers, vendors, or customers
Experience/Knowledge Required:
The kind of orange we are looking for will possess: Minimum time in position and performance management code requirements of V2 (or P3 in previous system)
Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and weekends Excellent communication skills and customer service skills
Knowledge of all policies, procedures and duties related to customer transactions, cash handling, the service desk and lot
1 year of supervisory experience
Excellent decision making ability and problem solving skills

Title: Cashier Supervisor - Kamloops, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Type: Full-Time
The Gateway to Your Future
If you lead with passion for people and service, then we’ve got an amazing opportunity for you! At the heart of the casino, you’ll mentor your team to ensure the smooth functioning of cashiering activities and promote a flawless guest experience!
We Provide
Full benefits package for full-time employees
Retirement savings plan
Exciting, supportive and fun work environment
Family and friends discounts on travel, tech, food, beverage, and fitness
Development and training opportunities
A Great Fit, if You
Are dynamic, energetic, and can bring out the best from your team
Are keen on details, can calculate numbers with precision, and work well with computers
Take initiative to resolve issues and are punctual, reliable and diligent in everything you do
Understand cashier operations, manage your time well, and juggle multiple tasks
Are a night owl and benefit from working flexible hours, evenings, and weekends
Key Responsibilities
Supervises cashiering activities and cage operations; manages the performance of Cashiers through training, coaching, and feedback
Ensures the integrity and accuracy of cage transactions and oversees large cash transaction procedures
Verifies cashier opening and closing floats, authorizes cage transactions, reconciles chip and vault inventories, monitors cash and coin levels and requests bank orders
Ensures a safe and well-organized department and oversees cage equipment maintenance
Completes reports, investigations, periodic audits and reconciliations
Manages process to deal with found money, postponed jackpots, unclaimed prizes
What You Bring
2 years of supervisory work experience or an equivalent combination of education, and experience preferred
1 year of experience as a casino Cashier preferred
Supervisory/management/leadership training an asset
Experience handling and balancing large amounts of cash with accuracy
Good manual dexterity and ability to kneel and crouch
Ability to pull, lift, and carry objects up to 35 lbs, and may push, pull or move a heavy cart
Ability to stand and walk for long periods of time
Completion of courses/training required by regulators
Ability to operate and troubleshoot cage machines
Why Work With Us?
Gateway celebrates and empowers our team members, who make it all possible. A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what it’s like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.
Get to Know Gateway
Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (“Gateway”) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.
Apply Now!
Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!
Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

Title: Sales Associate - Orillia, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Sales Associate
Sessions Cannabis is seeking applicants for the role of Sales Associate at our store in Orillia, Ontario. We are looking for dedicated individuals who understand the nuances of cannabis and are eager to enter this burgeoning industry.
Sessions Cannabis is a leading cannabis retailer with simple and relatable goals. It is our belief that cannabis is to be safe and accessible to everyone. We strive to support all aspects of the local community and seek to hire directly from the neighbourhoods we affiliate with to add stable, fulfilling, and enjoyable employment to those communities.
The ideal Sessions employee is compassionate, responsible and well-educated in cannabis. We are looking for individuals who can engage positively with their community and deliver excellent customer service in a fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities:
Greet customers throughout the day in a friendly and welcoming manner
Confidently represent the Sessions brand and ideals
Educate customers on cannabis products and how to safely consume cannabis
Facilitate the sale of regulated cannabis by discussing cannabis products and engaging customers in a variety of cannabis accessories
Maintain up to date knowledge of new trends and products in the industry
Effectively utilize a cannabis compliant POS system and cash register
Organize, receive and categorize cannabis products and accessories
Ensure the cleanliness of the store is maintained on a daily basis
Check identification of customers who appear to be 25 years of age or under
Abide by all company policies and procedures
Qualifications:
3-5 years of experience in a retail setting is preferred
Valid Cannsell Cannabis Retail Certification
A clean criminal background check from local authorities
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Must be a team player
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal skills
Availability for shift work any time between 8:30am to 11:30pm, Monday to Sunday
Basic skills in math and proficiency as a cashier
Extensive knowledge of cannabis products and accessories is an asset
Personal connection to the community is an asset
Must be 19 years of age or older
At Sessions Cannabis we offer competitive wages. The hourly wage for the position of Sales Associate is $16 per hour.
For more information, check out our website at www.sessions.ca. If this exciting new opportunity is of interest to you please submit a resume. We thank you for your interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Sessions Cannabis is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based upon merit, performance and the needs of the business. We value diversity and encourage all who meet the job’s qualifications to apply and join the Sessions team!
Sessions Cannabis will make every effort to accommodate candidates needs through the hiring process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Should you require any accommodations throughout the hiring process, please let us know.

Title: Arena Cashier Receptionist - Hall, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
JOB POSTING
Internal/External – CUPE Local 1050
Position: Arena Cashier/Receptionist Status: Seasonal Part-time
Posting Date: November 18, 2021
Application deadline: December 2, 2021, by
4pm
Competition number: 21-67
Wage: $22.32 (plus $1.20 per hour in lieu of
benefits)
How to apply:
Please send your resume with competition number, in confidence to:
Human Resources Manager
City of Quesnel,
410 Kinchant Street,
Quesnel, BC V2J 7J5
Apply online or by Email: hr@quesnel.ca (Word or pdf document only please)
The City of Quesnel requires part-time Cashier Receptionists for the Quesnel & District Arena
concessions during the winter ice season. If you have a strong background in customer
service and experience working in an office environment then this could be a good
opportunity for you.
The City of Quesnel is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are
committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Nature of Position
The Cashier/Receptionist is responsible for the customer service at the concession and front
office in the arena facility. This position is part-time in nature and day, evenings and/or
weekend shifts are required. Ideal for anyone with customer service experience who is
interested in part-time employment.
Typical Duties:

Answering and directing phone calls and other inquires in a competent and friendly
manner

Processing admissions

Maintaining the office/concession in a clean, safe, sanitary, operable and efficient
manner

Booking facilities from time to time when needed

Preparing and selling concession items

Assisting in filing, maintaining attendance records and cash reports, and performing
general office procedures

Operating office equipment

Stocking of concession

Maintaining inventory control

Related duties as assigned
Required Qualifications
The Concession/Receptionist must possess the following qualifications:

Grade 12 education

Minimum 1 year demonstrated cashier and switchboard experience

Minimum 1 year experience in food and beverage hospitality or in a related customer-
service focused area

First Aid and C.P.R. certificate is a requirement

Foodsafe Level 1 certificate is a requirement

Serving it Right certificate is a requirement

Ability to handle cash and maintain accurate records

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, word processing and excel

Knowledge of office procedures and preparation of business letters and forms

Ability to focus attention on patrons needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times

Ability to deal with the public and staff in a professional manner
Job related testing may be required.

Title: Term Full Time Facility Cashiers/Vaccination Screeners (Four - Six Month Term) - Yellowknife, NT - Indeed.com
Description:
The City of Yellowknife is an inclusive employer offering a dynamic and rewarding work environment that delivers valuable services to our residents. Working in Local Government provides many opportunities to not only develop your career but also to improve the lives of residents and visitors to Yellowknife! At the City, the diverse backgrounds of our employees help us to create a positive, safe and fun environment for us all. The City is committed to hiring a diverse and skilled workforce that is representative of the community, strengthening our ability to provide high quality services and excellent customer service to residents. In addition, the City of Yellowknife is committed to reconciliation and implementing actions intended to increase the number of Indigenous peoples who work for the City. The City of Yellowknife welcomes applications from all qualified candidates, and encourages Indigenous persons, visible minorities and persons with a disability to self-declare when submitting their application. We are currently seeking reliable and enthusiastic individuals to assume the full time positions of Cashier/Proof of Vaccination Screener with the Community Services Department for an approximate 4 -6 month term.
These positions require exceptional customer service skills, computer literacy and the ability to train in all cash functions. We are seeking candidates with flexibility in their availability and require shift coverage beginning as early as 7am until 11pm, Monday to Friday in all City Facilities. Shifts will be 8 hours in duration from 7am-3pm or 3pm-11pm. Please ensure to provide your availability in your application.
The City of Yellowknife offers an hourly wage of $16.23 plus a monthly housing and vacation travel allowance of $450.
Visit the City of Yellowknife Website at:
www.yellowknife.ca to submit your resume.
The closing date for this competition is December 3. 2021.
We thank all applicants who apply, but advise that only those to be interviewed will be contacted.
Please be advised that the City of Yellowknife requires all prospective employees over the age of 17 to provide a criminal records check prior to employment. We thank all applicants who apply, but advise that only those to be interviewed will be contacted.

The Cook produces high quality products in a fast-paced environment that exceed our guests’ expectations on every visit. Title: Cashier / Caissier- - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description
Laura Canada est une entreprise familiale iconique et innovatrice qui exploite Laura et Melanie Lyne, deux grandes bannières de vêtements pour femmes. Établie à Laval, au Québec, Laura Canada conçoit, produit, commercialise et distribue des vêtements de qualité partout au Canada. Nous sommes fiers d’employer plus de 2 000 collègues dévoués et d’exploiter plus de 140 magasins et deux boutiques en ligne. Notre succès repose sur l’engagement inconditionnel de notre équipe à offrir une expérience client exceptionnelle tout en incarnant nos valeurs d’intégrité, de respect, d’esprit d’équipe, de performance et de passion.
Nous croyons qu’une expérience client exceptionnelle est motivée par notre engagement à offrir une expérience exceptionnelle à nos employés.
Le genre masculin est utilisé comme générique, dans le seul but de ne pas alourdir le texte
Laura Canada is an iconic and innovative family-owned retailer housing two leading women’s fashion apparel brands, Laura and Melanie Lyne. Based in Laval, Quebec, we design, produce, market and distribute quality apparel across Canada. We proudly employ over 2,000 dedicated team members and operate more than 140 locations and two online stores. We attribute our success to the unwavering commitment of our team to delivering outstanding customer experiences while embodying our shared values of integrity, respect, teamwork, performance, and passion.
At Laura Canada, we believe that delivering an outstanding customer experience is driven by our commitment to an outstanding employee experience.
Job Description
Role Summary
The Laura Canada Service Coordinator assists with the management of merchandise in every way, including receiving, visual merchandising, window display, markdowns, cash desk and preparing outgoing merchandise. Provides exemplary service to all customers.﻿
Critical Functions
1. Customer Service
Provides exemplary customer service at cash desk (stop, drop and serve when a client needs assistance, manage line-up, acknowledge clients in line, fold and handle merchandise with care, thank the client, walk around counter to hand the purchase to client).
Captures all relevant customer information including emails and enter them into the CRM (Customer Relations Management) system.
Promotes effectively the loyalty program to all customers.
Promotes and executes Customers Orders.
Handles customer issues/questions related to returns, customer orders or exchanges in a professional and positive manner.
2. Merchandise and Visual Presentation
Unpacks and accurately verifies all incoming merchandise, steaming where necessary and removing excess tags in a timely manner.
Places goods on sales floor in accordance with visual merchandising directives.
Assists management by changing product placement within store to ensure color and product stories are coherent, especially as new goods are received regularly and older goods are sold.
Completes markdowns and prepares outgoing merchandise quickly and accurately.
Assists management by installing marketing signage throughout store, read Email and takes action.
Dresses window mannequins adhering to visual standards, including any mandatory directives that may be issued.
Is responsible in maintaining the cash desk clean and organized.
3. P.O.S System
Executes all P.O.S. procedures accurately and efficiently (i.e. refunds, transfers, customer orders, etc.).
Controls all cash handling and adheres to LP policies and procedures (i.e. float counts, deposits, etc.).
Places a sense of urgency in executing administrative requirements as directed (i.e. extracting communications received via email, customer orders, supply orders, etc.).
Requirements
Experience in a retail environment preferred
Sense of urgency
Basic computer skills
Conducts oneself in a professional manner.
Demonstrates initiative on an ongoing basis.
Positive attitude and confident
English and/or French as required
-
Sommaire du role
Le coordonnateur de service de Laura Canada aide à la gestion de la marchandise, incluant la réception de la marchandise, le marchandisage, la présentation dans les vitrines, les baisses de prix, le service au comptoir-caisse et la préparation de la marchandise à expédier. Il offre un service exemplaire à toutes les clientes.
Fonctions critiques
1.Service à la clientèle
Offre un service à la clientèle exemplaire au comptoir-caisse (interrompre ses tâches lorsqu’une cliente a besoin d’aide, gérer la file d’attente, saluer les clientes en file, plier et manipuler avec soin la marchandise, remercier la cliente, faire le tour du comptoir-caisse pour remettre l’achat à la cliente).
Recueille tous les renseignements pertinents sur les clientes, incluant les adresses courriel, et les entre dans le système G.R.C. (gestion de la relation avec la clientèle).
Fait efficacement la promotion du programme de fidélisation auprès de toutes les clientes.
Gère les problèmes de service à la clientèle et les questions relatives aux retours, commandes client et échanges de façon professionnelle et positive.
2. Marchandise et présentation visuelle
Déballe et vérifie avec exactitude toute la marchandise reçue, la passe à la vapeur au besoin et enlève les étiquettes superflues rapidement.
Aide les gestionnaires à changer l’emplacement des produits à l’intérieur du magasin pour s’assurer que les thèmes de marchandise et de couleurs sont cohérents, particulièrement lorsque de la nouvelle marchandise arrive régulièrement et que de l’ancienne marchandise se vend.
Aide les gestionnaires à changer l’emplacement des produits à l’intérieur du magasin pour s’assurer que les thèmes de marchandise et de couleurs sont cohérents, particulièrement lorsque de la nouvelle marchandise arrive régulièrement et que de l’ancienne marchandise se vend.
Effectue les baisses de prix et prépare la marchandise à expédier avec rapidité et exactitude.
3. Système P.D.V
Effectue rapidement et efficacement toutes les procédures P.D.V. (ex. : remboursements, transferts, commandes client, etc.).
Contrôle toutes les manipulations d’argent et respecte les politiques et procédures de prévention des pertes (ex. : comptes du fonds de roulement, dépôts, etc.).
Manifeste un sentiment d’urgence dans l’accomplissement des tâches administratives demandées (ex. : retirer les communications reçues par courriel, faire les commandes client et les commandes de fournitures, etc.).
Exigences
Expérience dans la vente au détail de préférence
Grande intuition pour la présentation visuelle
Sentiment d’urgence
Effectuer les tâches rapidement.
Connaissance de base en informatique.
Excellentes aptitudes en communication et entregent
Se conduire de façon professionnelle.
Capacité d’accepter les commentaires et d’apporter rapidement des changements
Faire preuve d’initiative sur une base continue.
Souci du détail
Attitude positive et confiante
Passion de continuer à apprendre, à s’épanouir et à s’adapter
Français ou anglais, selon le cas
